% Table 1: Main Results
% ============================================
\begin{table}[t]
\centering
\caption{Sycophancy reduction results across datasets. \textit{Baseline} shows the sycophancy rate of DeepSeek-7B under biased prompts. \textit{Module} shows the rate after our pipeline (Module 1 detection + Module 2 verification + debiased prompting). \textit{Fix Rate} is the percentage of sycophantic baseline responses corrected by the module.}
\label{tab:main_results}
\begin{tabular}{lcccccc}
\toprule
Dataset & $N$ & Baseline Syc.\% & Module Syc.\% & Fixed & Still Syc. & Fix Rate\% \\
\midrule
NLP Survey & 100 & 98.0 & 1.0 & 97/98 & 1/98 & 99.0 \\
PhilPapers & 100 & 40.0 & 65.0 & 6/40 & 34/40 & 15.0 \\
Political Typology & 100 & 93.0 & 43.0 & 55/93 & 38/93 & 59.1 \\
\midrule
\textbf{Aggregate} & 300 & 77.0 & 36.3 & 158/231 & 73/231 & 68.4 \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\end{table}

\centering
\caption{Outcome breakdown showing all four possible transitions. \textit{Introduced} indicates cases where the module's debiased prompt caused the model to switch to the sycophantic answer (false positive harm).}

\begin{tabular}{lccccc}
\toprule
Dataset & Fixed & Still Syc. & Introduced & Both Indep. & Judge Score \\

\midrule
NLP Survey & 97 & 1 & 0 & 2 & 3.98 \\
PhilPapers & 6 & 34 & 31 & 29 & 2.75 \\
Political Typology & 55 & 38 & 5 & 2 & 3.18 \\
